definitions.definition: an animal, especially one that is large or dangerous, or one that is unusual

examples.text: **mythical beasts** such as unicorns and dragons
Savage beasts once roamed these forests.
The princess came face-to-face with a hideous wild beast.
They found the fossilized skeletons of prehistoric beasts.

definitions.definition: a person who is cruel and whose behaviour shows a lack of control

examples.text: The beast in her wanted to destroy his house.
Somehow I brought out the beast in him.
Local people live in fear of this unknown sex beast.
The maths exam was a real beast.

definitions.definition: a thing of a particular kind

examples.text: His new guitar is a very expensive beast.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French beste, based on Latin bestia.
